info.title: Paris 2024 Olympic Games Ticketing API
info.description:
This API manages the entire ticket lifecycle for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, covering:

- User registration and profile management

- Shopping cart and payment processing

- Ticket generation and entry validation


Developed as part of a Bachelor's in Digital Solutions Development, it follows a modular Laravel monolith architecture,
organized into internal packages (users, tickets, cart, payment, etc.) for maintainability and scalability.

Notifications (emails and system messages) are handled internally via a dedicated Laravel service and are not exposed publicly.

Access is secured by a restrictive CORS policy and token-based authentication (Laravel Sanctum).

get.description:
Returns the current cart contents:

- **Authenticated users**: full cart model (cart ID, user ID, items with product details)
- **Guests**: a simple map of product IDs to quantities

Provide a Bearer token to operate on the user’s cart; omit it to operate on the guest cart.

data.description: Map of product IDs to quantities

patch.summary: Set cart item quantity or remove item
patch.description:
Updates the quantity for a given product in the current cart:

- **quantity > 0**: set the new quantity
- **quantity = 0**: remove the item from the cart

Accessible by guests and authenticated users. Provide a Bearer token to update the user’s cart; omit it to update the guest cart.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: ID of the product to update

delete.description: Deletes every item from the current authenticated user’s shopping cart. Requires a valid Bearer token.

get.summary: Retrieve a paginated list of in-stock products
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of products that are currently in stock.

**Optional query parameters**:
- `name`       — filter by product name
- `category`   — filter by category
- `location`   — filter by location
- `date`       — filter by date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `places`     — filter by minimum number of places
- `sort_by`    — sort field (`name`, `price`, `product_details->date`)
- `order`      — sort direction (`asc`, `desc`)
- `per_page`   — items per page (default: 15)
- `page`       — page number (default: 1)

post.description:
Allows an administrator to create a new employee account.
The new user is immediately active and email‐verified. Password must meet security requirements.

This endpoint allows a visitor to create a new user account with built-in protections:
- **Strong password enforcement**: minimum 15 characters, mixed case, numbers & symbols
- **Google reCAPTCHA** verification to block bots and automated abuse
- **Throttling** (e.g. 5 requests/minute) to limit spam & brute-force attempts
- **Email confirmation**: a verification link is sent after registration

201.description: User created successfull. Verification Email sended.

message.example: Registration successful. Please check your emails.

post.description:
This endpoint allows a user to log in and receive an authentication token:

- **Email & password** credentials are required
- **Remember me** option for extended session duration (1 week)
- **Two-factor authentication (2FA)** code if enabled
- **Throttling** to limit brute-force attempts

remember.description: Stay logged in for one week

200.description: Authentication successful. Returns a token and user information.

400.description: Bad request (e.g. email not verified or missing/invalid 2FA code)

post.description:
Generates a new secret key for two-factor authentication and returns an OTP-Auth URL.
Requires the user to be authenticated via Bearer token.

qrCodeUrl.description: URL to generate QR code for 2FA

post.description: Revokes the token used for authentication. Requires a valid Bearer token.

Sends an email containing a password reset link to the user.

- Requires a valid email of an existing user.
- Response does not reveal if the email is registered, to prevent enumeration.

500.description: Internal server error or email send failure

post.description:
Allows a user to reset their password using a valid reset token:

- `token`: the password reset token
- `email`: user’s email (must exist)
- `password` + `password_confirmation`: new secure password (min 15 chars, mixed case, numbers, symbols)

message.example: Your password has been reset successfully.
No user found with this email

patch.description:

- Provide `current_password` to verify identity
- Set a new secure password (min. 15 chars, mixed case, numbers & symbols)

current_password.description: The current password of the user

password.description: The new password to be set for the user

get.description:
Validates the email verification link.
- In **production**, redirects the user to the frontend at `/verification-result/{success|invalid|already-verified|error}`.
- In **non-production**, returns a JSON payload with `message` and `redirect_url`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the user to verify

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: SHA1 hash from the verification link

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: Expiration timestamp of the signed URL

200.description: Email verified successfully (JSON response in non-production)

redirect_url.description: Used for redirection only in production. In development, a JSON response will be returned.

302.description: Redirect to frontend verification result page (production)

post.description: Sends a new email verification link to the authenticated user. Requires a valid Bearer token.

get.description:
Validates the token for a pending email change.
- In **production**, redirects to the front at `/verification-result/{success|invalid|error}`.
- In **non-production**, returns JSON with `message` and `redirect_url`.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Raw verification token from the email link

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: Expiration timestamp of the signed URL

get.description:
Validates the token for a pending email change and restores the old email during 48 hours.
- In **production**, redirects the user to `/verification-result/{success|invalid|error}`.
- In **non-production**, returns JSON with `message` and `redirect_url`.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Raw token from the email update link

parameters.name: old_email
parameters.description: Previous email address before the update

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: Expiration timestamp of the signed URL

200.description: Email update canceled successfully (JSON in non-production)

404.description: Email update request not found or already processed
